42
Advantages and disadvantages
• Advantages: 
– Including as much linguistic information as wished is possible
– Linguistic elements within one language or across languages can be 
linked. 
– Nuances or differences between languages can be reported and 
formalized at the terminological layer 
– Relevant information as, e.g., the provenance of the linguistic elements, 
can also be included. 
– Ontology development expertise is not necessary for linguists and 
domain experts to access the terminological layer in a distributed 
environment.
• Disadvantages: 
– Some language specificities could be lost, unless captured in language 
specific ontology modules, i.e., in the conceptual layer, or in the 
linguistic model, i.e., at the terminological layer.
